job.title: Computer Science / Computer Engineer Co-op (Automotive Wheel Balancing)
job.description:
Hunter Engineering Company is a global leader in the development and manufacturing of computer based automotive service equipment. Hunter’s award-winning research and development team of engineers is responsible for hundreds of patented and exclusive features on our equipment.      We are in search of enthusiastic and self-motivated sophomores, juniors, or seniors with a major or minor in a field of study cohesive with Computer Science and/or Computer Engineering. Our goal is to provide an experience that will teach by example how to progress from academics-based software projects to real world successful product(s).      Job Summary      This position is primarily responsible for the writing of new test software to automate data gathering and work with the QA Department and Project Engineers to maintain existing software.       CS/CE C++ Co-Ops gain experience in:       Software Quality Assurance     -  Exposure to Software Version Control and the debugging environment through Visual Studio    
  -  Work with Hunter’s QA Department and Project Engineers to maintain existing software.    
  -  Learn concepts of multiple models (varying feature sets) support and backwards compatibility.    
  -  Write new test software to automate data gathering       
New Feature Development / Testing     -  Learn how mechanical aspects influence software during the design process, working directly with Mechanical Engineers and ME Co-Ops.    
  -  Execute test plans under the direction of a project engineer, format the results in a useable and effective manner, and analyze the results against stated objectives    
  -  Minor analysis and engineering calculations       
Equipment Evaluation     -  Gain experience assisting with competitive analysis and equipment operation.       
Capstone Presentation / Exposure to Upper Leadership     -  Near the end of the job, our C++/balancer Co-Op students are well equipped to prepare a compelling Capstone PowerPoint presentation    
  -  Co-Ops can present their presentations live to all the other Co-Ops and upper management/leadership.       
Responsibilities      The individual will be involved in a variety of projects which may include:     -  Prototype construction and evaluation    
  -  Test program development and administration    
  -  Shop experience, hands-on work experience    
  -  Minor analysis and engineering calculations    
  -  Analyzing data and using Microsoft Word and Excel to prepare reports    
  -  Design and Fabricate Test Fixtures       
What To Expect       Qualifications       It will be our intent and purpose to provide the individual with real world experience, which includes assisting in the progression of a product from concept stage to production. The work done by co-ops in this position is applied to actual Hunter products. The work is normally very individualized even if you are working in a larger group. We host many co-ops annually. Our goal is to provide an experience that will be an important, effective first step in the career of a future engineer.      Also visit our website for testimonials from previous co-ops      https://www.hunter.com/about-us/careers/co-op/      Qualifications     -  Minimum 3.0 GPA (must be on resume)    
  -  Majo/Minor studies in Computer Scienceand/ or Computer Engineering    
  -  Experience with C++, Linux and/or Microsoft VS a plus    
  -  Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint    
  -  Excellent communication skills.
